title: How do you send tickets to report obnoxious players nowadays?
body:
I remember the old Support Ticket used to have some functionality for sending chat logs of toxic players in hopes of getting him punished or something along the lines, I can't seem to find it now atm. (let's just say I am quite iffy about the reliability of the report system)

______________
_____________

I have an unpopular opinion about a champ, which I argued about it with 2 people in-game which, well it happens and I'm k with that.

What I am not fine with is how because it's an unpopular opinion it somehow means "I am open to get any kind of insults thrown directly at my face and it's cool" to those 2 people. I mean come on.

1. Way to tell me that I'm in Bronze and somehow it's a bad thing socially or intellectually to be there. 
2. Way to assume my age and imagine that I get bullied a lot at school (lol?). 
3. Way to tell me I have autism and asperger while disrespecting those who actually have them too because why not. 
4. And way to assume I'm suicidal and be "kind" enough to encourage me not to do so.

etc etc.

I don't think it's okay, not at all, especially the stuff they threw at me as the fight went on, well more like one of them because the other one quit it slightly earlier which I do kinda appreciate. 

Yes I generally take shiet talking with a grain of salt thesedays, but to me there is a line between general trashing about and being downright offensive, I think at least 1 of those 2 definitely cross that line one way or the other.

Call me sensitive and that I need to grow a thicker skin. I just at a personal level don't find their attitude sitting right with me and I wish to get them punished, even a wrist slap would be fine to serve as a reminder. 

But oh well.

replies.body:
Are you kidding me? You start a fight yourself and then want to report the participants? If anything I think everyone involved should be reported. 

You realized things were getting out of hand and chose not to mute the summoners, you have little right to complain about any mistreatment from that point onwards. Their behaviour is not excusable but neither is yours, you can't continue reply and provoke players, then claim they insulted you.

> [{quoted}](name=Telecasterdude,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3b05hejY,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-09-18T10:42:39.131+0000)
>
> Are you kidding me? You start a fight yourself and then want to report the participants? If anything I think everyone involved should be reported. 
> 
> You realized things were getting out of hand and chose not to mute the summoners, you have little right to complain about any mistreatment from that point onwards. Their behaviour is not excusable but neither is yours, you can't continue reply and provoke players, then claim they insulted you.

Why is stating an opinion equivalent to starting a fight myself?

The Lee (the champ I complained) player was in the enemy team mind you, while the ones jumping onto my arse were on my team, who I wasn't even talking to. The guy didn't participate this so called fight nor was I even trying to start it in the first place.

If the one who was playing the champ I expressed complaints about were not even protesting against me voicing my thoughts, others have no right to come around and slap my face because my views don't align with theirs. it doesn't work that way.

It's not my fault if someone decides to be an arsehole over a statement that isn't even directed at anywhere near him.

Lets get this straight;

You chose to voice your opinion in a chat, and others chose to challenge that opinion. Everyone was acting within their rights here. Then you claim 2 players on your team began to harass you.

1. You chose not to mute these players, even though you clearly identified that the conversation was becoming abusive.
2. You chose to actively reply to harassment, which is stupid and doesn't help your case at all.

3. "others have no right to tell me to stop" 100% agree as long as you were not harassing them. But if you choose to continue an abusive argument, you should be partially liable for anything that happens beyond that point 

Think of it this way; you're driving a car and you have the right of way. You see someone illegally coming in the opposite direction at an incredible speed, you have plenty of time to avoid this accident but choose not to. You are now partially liable for anything that happens beyond this point.

> [{quoted}](name=Telecasterdude,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3b05hejY,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-09-18T12:17:44.248+0000)
>
> Lets get this straight;
> 
> You chose to voice your opinion in a chat, and others chose to challenge that opinion. Everyone was acting within their rights here. Then you claim 2 players on your team began to harass you.

No they didn't act within their right. This wasn't a contest gone wrong, it was a full on battle to begin with.

You see, I wasn't doing that great during the match (in fact I performed really badly), and had the audacity to say a thing or 2 about my displeasure with seeing Lee in a match because fk me right?

>others have no right to tell me to stop" 100% agree as long as you were not harassing them. But if you choose to continue an abusive argument, you should be partially liable for anything that happens beyond that point 

I didn't "continue" per se, all I was trying to do is give them an idea on how problematic Lee as a champ is while all they do is telling me that I'm wrong, stupid, disabled, suicidal and whatnot.

Which later on I simply took a backseat and feed them with "k" and see how things goes, and it got a lot nastier as time went on, even though I barely said anything.

If the players go out of their ways to act stupid on a comment that wasn't even directed at them and was merely using it as an excuse to vent out on someone viciously, they deserve a heads up or 2, that's all there is to it.

EDIT: Ofc I am not complaining about the result here, what I have problems with is their attitude. I am not moaning about my broken bones because I didn't dodge the car, I am simply saying they shouldn't even be coming after me because I said something to a guy that they heard, which got them pissed for no reason.

We're almost there;

They did act within their rights until they started to harass you. If you have the right to voice an opinion in chat, they also have the right to return an opinion in a civilized manner, just like we are doing now. I hope we're clear on that.

> Which later on I simply took a backseat and feed them with "k" and see how things goes

You can't do this. If I was moderating the tribunal I would not consider you innocent. If you didn't like their behaviour, why would you bait them to give you more? This is actually a form of trolling/griefing, cannibal trolling or something. You're just trying to bring out the worst in the community.

Either way it doesn't matter that much. The new automated tribunal only bans the one's who swear in chat. You could have gone on to intentionally feed because of Lee Sin and chances are you wouldn't have been banned.
